abstract: Oracle said Friday that it had agreed to buy the drug data management software company Phase Forward for about $685 million in a deal aimed at bolstering its health sciences business.
snippet: Oracle said Friday that it had agreed to buy the drug data management software company Phase Forward for about $685 million in a deal aimed at bolstering its health sciences business.
lead_paragraph: Oracle said Friday that it had agreed to buy the drug data management software company Phase Forward for about $685 million in a deal aimed at bolstering its health sciences business, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Oracle to Buy Phase Forward for $685 Million
